conclusion: Analyze the motion of the rods on the inclined rails, considering forces and energy changes.

Two parallel metal rails inclined at an angle of 30 degrees to the horizontal with rods a and b placed on them. A uniform magnetic field is directed vertically. A force of 2 N is applied to rod a to pull it upward.
Acceleration due to gravity on the inclined rails is g sin theta.
Acceleration of rod a is calculated as a = (F - m_a g sin theta) / m_a.
Energy dissipated by rod a due to resistance is Q_a = 0.12 J, which is converted into heat, so the change in kinetic energy of rod a is Delta KE_a = Q_a = 0.12 J.
Using the kinetic energy formula, find the speed of rod a before energy loss: v_{a0} = sqrt((2 * Delta KE_a) / m_a) = sqrt((2 * 0.12) / 0.3) = 1.0 m/s.
Since rods are connected, they have the same acceleration. The speed of rod b is therefore v_b = v_{a0} = 1.0 m/s.
